content.description: Start sitting with in the middle of the face, left hand good crimp, right hand smaller crimp. Climb with left hand on arete and right hand on various face crimps to a big right hand move to a slopping pinch. Easy topout left exit. (optional slopper start left goes at about the same grade)
content.location: Xhosa is located at the base of the left side of the cliff, from the outhouse (near parking) walk directly up to the cliff.

content.description: Start low sitting on the arete. Climb with left hand on arete and right hand on face holds.
content.location: to the left of genie baboo

content.description: Start on obvious rail at chest height, smear feet and fire up right to a nice gaston. Continue to a fun top out straight up.
content.location: Two levels straight up from margin walker, toward the cliff

content.description: Start low left matched in the seam, stacking hands (alternate beta using right hand 3' over). Crux is the first two moves to a friendly just often dirty top out right with a mantle on seam. Some may choose to climb reachier moves as a direct top out which has been cleaned summer 2011.
Sit start far left at the end of the undercling flake and traverse to the corner. Reach around for good corner hold then pull through to escape onto easier terrain and top out.
content.location: Left of genie baboo on juggler boulder

content.description: Finding the holds when the slab see slow traffic is the crux.
The crux is perching on the low underclings and working upper the overhanging belly.
content.protection: Tricky landing, more pads the better
content.location: First large obvious overhanging boulder you see on the left. Start matched on underclings and climb straight up over lip.

content.description: Start matched on low left jug and work up the right leaning arete.
Start matched on the obvious lip-pinch-hold with right heel hook. Progress through the hard rail of sloopers (similar to Numb Thumb, but harder)

Start as for genie baboo but with right hand on undercling instead of left. Left hand starts on arete edge. OG beta calls for toe hook out left to move off undercling followed by toe hook out right to slap up the sides. Grab the spine to top out.
content.location: Front of juggler boulder when approached from the road. Shares start with genie baboo

content.description: Goes a a slippery V1 to the top with bottom and top edges off. Start left hand high and right hand in lower crack
content.location: Back slab of juggler/genie baboo boulder. To the right of trail before you reach the pond

content.description: From the amazing undercling left of Genie Baboo, follow a left leaning arete/lip to the very top of the boulder. A small seam tracks this arete and peters out 2/3rds of the way up. Figure something out and then make a crux reach to a jug! Good boulder!V5- might be a generous grade but you tell me.
Twitchell pond classic, Start left hand undercling and right hand on the low right jug seam just beyond the arete.
Did this route back in the early 2000's... It climbs an arete of a block down low in the boulder field. Anyone got any more info?

A Quiet area, we should keep it that way.Keep this place quiet and it should be OK. Let’s not lose what planet Earth provides. The rock is owned by a different person than the parking and lake front but neither live there.If the road is blocked by homeowners’ parking on it, BE KIND !  It is a private road and if there are negative interactions we could end up losing access to this gem of a spot.Best to keep a kind, low and shallow profile here. Don’t swim, don’t camp, don’t hang-out and no fires. It’s all tempting, but please just arrive, climb and then leave QUIETLY and we should be OK. ( added by R Hall, MtnPrjct Admin for ME from comments by M.Moran and Matt Webb.)
